program_goal: To enhance athletes speed, acceleration, change of direction/agility and movement proficiency.
program_description: This program was designed to be simple enough to follow for HS/College athletes training solo or with their team as well as for the general fitness seeker who still is looking to improve performance. The Field Day Program consists of 3 days. Day 1 is focused on Acceleration. Day 2 is focused on top end speed. Day 3 is focused on change of direction, lateral movements and agility. Each Day consists of a daily warm up, drills, plyometrics and then specific focused workouts to improve the focus of that day. In total, this program is 18 total days of workouts. This program progresses slowly each week as needed to build upon skill work and drills. The purpose of this is to expose athletes with a baseline of movement proficiency and gradually increase their skill through more difficult progressions. It is important to not skip steps. It is also important to note that NOT every week we will increase intensity or movement difficulty and that should be time spent on mastering a movement. If you feel you need to stick with a lesser advanced version, or repeat a week until you mastered a movement, please do so! Go at the pace that best suits you! The workouts + warm up are designed to take 30-45 minutes total. I advocate for you to take as much rest as you need after movements to feel fully fresh for each rep. The reason why is that while SPEED/AGILITY work should be done at max intensity and focus, the focus is NOT on excessive volume or tiring the athlete just for the sake of tiring the athlete. A lot of programs you see online labeled as speed/agility programs are actually conditioning workouts. This is where the field day program stands out! I want you to be fresh each rep so you can be fast! If you complete every drill, read the notes, and do each drill with intent, you will see improvements! It is recommended to NOT do this workout 3 days in a row and ideally you do it every other day such as MWF or T/Th/Sat. Be sure to watch all the mini demo videos beforehand as well.
medical_disclaimer: Like any online program or fitness advice, please consult with a doctor first prior to completing any workout. Modify exercises as needed and be sure to consult with a doctor and health care provider before beginning any workout program.
workout_order_instruction: Go in order from Warm up to A Block then B Block, then C Block then D Block.
author_contact: Follow me on Instagram and Twitter @ JoeAratari. Visit me online at JoeAratari.com

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) HURDLE HOP Progression 1
exercises.notes: Watch video and do progression #1 only. If no hurdles, use cones or immaginary hurdles
exercises.exercise_summary: Basic hurdle hops focusing on progression 1. Involves controlled, rhythmic hopping over low hurdles (or substitutes like cones), emphasizing quick ground contact, proper leg action, and coordination for each foot.

exercises.name: A2) Learn to Skip
exercises.exercise_summary: Fundamental skipping drill performed forwards and backwards. Focuses on developing coordination, rhythm, light foot contacts, and proper arm/leg action essential for running mechanics.

exercises.name: B1) No Countermovement Broad Jump + Stick
exercises.exercise_summary: A broad jump performed from a static start without any preliminary dipping or arm swing. Emphasizes explosive horizontal power and requires a stable, controlled landing ('stick').

exercises.name: B2) Countermovement Vertical Jump + Stick
exercises.exercise_summary: A vertical jump performed with a preparatory countermovement (dip and arm swing) to maximize jump height. Focuses on explosive vertical power and a controlled, stable landing ('stick').

exercises.name: C1) Wall Tension ISO holds
exercises.sets_reps:
3 reps per side
5 second hold each
exercises.notes: -Think to create as much FORCE as possible
exercises.exercise_summary: An isometric exercise where the athlete leans against a wall in an acceleration posture (forward lean, one knee up). Focuses on generating maximum sustained force into the wall for the specified duration on each side.

exercises.name: D1) Push Up Sprints
exercises.sets_reps:
x4, 10 yards
2 Right foot
2 Left foot
exercises.notes: -Full 60 seconds rest between each sprint
exercises.exercise_summary: Starting from a push-up (prone) position, the athlete explosively gets up and sprints for 10 yards. This drill develops explosive starting strength and the ability to transition quickly from the ground to sprinting. Performed leading with each foot.

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) Skips
exercises.notes: Be Twitchy and fast with each rep
exercises.exercise_summary: Dynamic skips performed forwards and backwards, emphasizing quick, 'twitchy' movements and fast ground contact. Focuses on developing rhythm, coordination, and explosive leg action.

exercises.name: A2) 45 Degree Bound + Stick
exercises.notes: Get out as far as you can with each Jump
exercises.exercise_summary: Bounding forward and outward at a 45-degree angle off one leg, aiming for maximum distance on each jump. Requires a stable landing ('stick') on the opposite foot. Develops unilateral power and control.

blocks.block_name: B: Top End Speed Focused Plyos/Drills

exercises.name: B1) Pogos
exercises.notes: Be Springy and elastic!
exercises.exercise_summary: Short, quick, repetitive vertical jumps primarily using the ankles and lower legs, keeping knees relatively straight. Focuses on developing ankle stiffness, elasticity, and rapid force production.

exercises.name: B2) Backwards Sprint
exercises.exercise_summary: Sprinting backwards for 20 yards. This drill enhances coordination, balance, hamstring and glute activation, and body awareness while moving in a less familiar pattern.

exercises.name: C1) Rolling (walk in sprints)
exercises.notes: -2 Minute rest between each
exercises.exercise_summary: Starting from a walk, the athlete gradually and smoothly accelerates into a full sprint over a 20-yard distance. Focuses on controlled acceleration and building up to top speed.

exercises.name: D1) 20 Yard Sprint-ALL OUT SPRINT
exercises.notes:
-2 Minutes rest between each
-Time if possible (laser or handtime)
exercises.exercise_summary: Maximum effort sprints over 20 yards. Designed to develop and express top-end speed over a short distance. Timing is encouraged to track progress.

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) Learn to Lateral March
exercises.exercise_summary: A foundational lateral movement drill involving marching sideways. Focuses on hip mobility, adductor/abductor strength, and coordination for lateral agility. Performed to the left and right.

exercises.name: A2) Learn to Lateral A-Skip
exercises.notes:
Go slow before adding speed
Get distance between each skip once mastered
exercises.exercise_summary: An A-Skip performed laterally, focusing on high knee drive and coordinated arm action while moving sideways. Start slow to master the movement, then increase speed and distance between skips.

exercises.name: B1) Lateral Leap to 2 foot stick
exercises.exercise_summary: A plyometric drill involving a powerful leap sideways off one foot, landing on both feet simultaneously. Emphasizes lateral power generation and stable bilateral landing mechanics.

exercises.name: B2) Lateral Leap to 1 foot Stick
exercises.exercise_summary: A plyometric drill involving a powerful leap sideways off one foot, landing on the opposite single foot. Challenges lateral power, unilateral stability, balance, and control during landing.

exercises.name: C1) Crossover Sprints
exercises.sets_reps:
x2 left and right
x15 yards
(4 total)
exercises.notes:
-Full 60 seonds rest between
-Race if you have a partner
exercises.exercise_summary: Sprints that incorporate a crossover step to initiate movement or change direction laterally. Focuses on agility, quick footwork, and the ability to accelerate after a lateral movement. Performed to both left and right sides.

exercises.name: D1) 8 Meter Curved Sprints
exercises.notes:
-Angles/Edges, Stay close to the line at max speed!
-Full 60 seconds rest between each sprint
exercises.exercise_summary: Sprinting at maximum speed around a curve or arc for 8 meters. Emphasizes maintaining speed while leaning into the turn and controlling body position on angles/edges. Performed in both directions.

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) HURDLE HOP Progression #2
exercises.notes: Watch video and do progression #2 only. If no hurdles, use cones or immaginary hurdles
exercises.exercise_summary: Progression 2 of hurdle hops, advancing from the basic pattern. This may involve a different rhythm, height, or complexity of movement over the hurdles, continuing to build coordination and quick ground contact.

exercises.name: A2) Mini Bounds
exercises.exercise_summary: Short, repetitive bounding movements performed forwards and backwards over 15 yards. Focuses on horizontal displacement, quick ground contact, and developing elastic strength in the lower body.

exercises.name: B1) No Countermovement Broad Jump + Stick
exercises.exercise_summary: A broad jump performed from a static start without a countermovement, focusing on explosive horizontal power. Requires a stable, controlled landing ('stick'). Reps increased from week 1.

exercises.name: B2) Split Squat Jump + Pause
exercises.notes:
Jump up and switch legs + stick landing
Focus is on height
exercises.exercise_summary: Explosive jump from a split squat (lunge) position, switching leg positions in mid-air and landing in a split squat on the opposite side. Emphasizes vertical power, coordination, and a stable 'stick' landing with a pause. Focus on jump height.

exercises.name: C1) Wall Tension ISO holds
exercises.sets_reps:
5 reps per side
5 second hold each
exercises.notes: -Think to create as much FORCE as possible
exercises.exercise_summary: Isometric hold against a wall in an acceleration posture. Focus on generating maximum sustained force into the wall. Reps increased from week 1.

exercises.name: D1) Push Up Sprints
exercises.sets_reps:
x6, 10 yards
3 Right foot
3 Left foot
exercises.notes: -Full 60 seconds rest between each sprint
exercises.exercise_summary: Starting from a push-up position, explode up into a 10-yard sprint. Develops explosive starting strength. Reps increased from week 1, leading with each foot.

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) A-Skips
exercises.exercise_summary: A dynamic skipping drill focusing on high knee drive (thigh parallel to the ground) and a forceful downward strike of the foot directly beneath the hips. Performed forwards and backwards to enhance running mechanics.

exercises.name: A2) Dynamic Hamstring Carch
exercises.exercise_summary: A dynamic hamstring stretch involving a controlled leg swing or 'walking Carch' (Core And Reach Hamstring) movement, focusing on improving hamstring flexibility and core engagement. Performed for 5 repetitions on each leg.

blocks.block_name: B: Top End Speed Focused Plyos/Drills

exercises.name: B1) Quick Double Tap Pogos
exercises.notes: Be as quick as you can on the double hop
exercises.exercise_summary: A variation of pogos where the athlete performs a quick double tap of the feet on the ground between each small vertical hop. Emphasizes rapid ankle action, minimal ground contact time, and elasticity over 15 yards.

exercises.name: B2) Backwards Sprint
exercises.exercise_summary: Sprinting backwards for 20 yards. Enhances coordination, balance, and posterior chain activation. (Same as W1D2).

exercises.name: C1) Rolling (walk in sprints)
exercises.notes: -2 Minute rest between each
exercises.exercise_summary: Starting from a walk, gradually accelerate into a full sprint over 20 yards. Focuses on smooth transition to top speed. (Same as W1D2).

exercises.name: D1) 25 Yard Sprint-ALL OUT SPRINT
exercises.notes:
-2 Minutes rest between each
-Time if possible (laser or handtime)
exercises.exercise_summary: Maximum effort sprints over 25 yards. Aims to develop and express top-end speed. Distance increased from week 1, total reps increased.

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) Lateral March
exercises.exercise_summary: Lateral marching drill focusing on hip and leg movement for lateral agility. Distance increased to 15 yards L/R.

exercises.name: A2) Learn to Lateral A-Skip
exercises.exercise_summary: Lateral A-Skip, focusing on high knee drive and lateral movement. Distance increased to 15 yards L/R.

exercises.name: B1) Lateral Leap to 2 foot stick
exercises.exercise_summary: A lateral leap off one foot, landing on two feet and sticking the landing. Reps increased to 5 each way.

exercises.name: B2) Lateral Leap to 1 foot Stick
exercises.exercise_summary: A lateral leap off one foot, landing on the opposite foot and sticking the landing. Reps increased to 5 each way.

exercises.name: C1) Crossover Sprints
exercises.sets_reps:
x3 left and right
x15 yards
(6 total)
exercises.notes:
-Full 60 seonds rest between
-Race if you have a partner
exercises.exercise_summary: Sprints incorporating a crossover step for lateral movement and acceleration. Reps increased to 3 each side.

exercises.name: D1) 8 Meter Curved Sprints
exercises.notes:
-Angles/Edges, Stay close to the line at max speed!
-1-2 min rest after each sprint
exercises.exercise_summary: Sprinting around a curve for 8 meters, focusing on maintaining speed on angles. Rest between sprints increased to 1-2 minutes. (Total reps remain 6, 3 each way)

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) HURDLE HOP Progression 3
exercises.notes: Watch video and do progression #3 only. If no hurdles, use cones or immaginary hurdles
exercises.exercise_summary: Progression 3 of hurdle hops, further increasing the complexity, speed, or height of the hops over hurdles. Continues to build plyometric ability and coordination.

exercises.name: A2) Power Skip
exercises.exercise_summary: Skips performed with an emphasis on maximizing both height and distance with each skip. Focuses on explosive power generation from each leg push-off.

exercises.name: B1) Continuous Broad Jumps
exercises.notes: Stick the last jump
exercises.exercise_summary: A series of broad jumps performed consecutively without pausing between jumps, except for sticking the landing on the final jump of the set. Develops reactive strength and sustained horizontal power.

exercises.name: B2) Depth Jump For Height
exercises.notes: Get into your hips and think HEIGHT
exercises.exercise_summary: Dropping off a low box or step and immediately exploding into a maximal vertical jump upon ground contact. Emphasizes minimizing ground contact time and maximizing jump height by utilizing the stretch-shortening cycle. Focus on hip engagement and aiming for height.

exercises.name: C1) Wall Drill-Quick Switches
exercises.exercise_summary: Facing a wall with hands placed on it for support, rapidly switch leg positions as if performing high knees against the wall. Focuses on quick hip flexion and extension, mimicking acceleration leg mechanics.

exercises.name: D1) Switching Gear Sprints
exercises.notes: -Full 60 seonds rest between each sprint
exercises.exercise_summary: Sprints over 20 yards where the athlete intentionally changes their running speed or 'gear' (e.g., from 70% to 90% to 100% effort) at designated points. Develops the ability to accelerate multiple times within a single sprint.

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) A-Skips
exercises.exercise_summary: Dynamic A-Skips focusing on high knee drive and forceful downward foot strike. Distance adjusted, possibly for quality focus.

exercises.name: A2) Bounds
exercises.exercise_summary: Exaggerated running strides where the goal is to maximize air time and horizontal distance covered with each step. Develops powerful leg drive and hip extension.

blocks.block_name: B: Top End Speed Focused Plyos/Drills

exercises.name: B1) Split squat jump + Pause
exercises.exercise_summary: Explosive jump from a split squat position, switching legs mid-air and landing with a pause. (Same as W2D1B2).

exercises.name: B2) Medball Alternating Drop Backs
exercises.exercise_summary: While holding a medicine ball, perform alternating drop-back lunges or steps, moving over a 10-yard distance. This drill challenges core stability, balance, and coordination under load.

exercises.name: C1) Backward Sprint
exercises.notes: -2 Minute rest between each
exercises.exercise_summary: Sprinting backward for 20 yards. Reps increased to 4, continuing to build posterior chain strength and coordination.

exercises.name: D1) Sprint Build ups
exercises.notes:
Gradually pick up speed/intensity every 10 yards
-FULL 4 min rest after each sprint
exercises.exercise_summary: Sprints where speed is progressively increased over a set distance (e.g., building speed every 10 yards). This helps athletes learn to control and increase their speed smoothly, culminating in maximal effort. Long rest for recovery.

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) Lateral Skips
exercises.exercise_summary: Skips performed moving laterally (sideways). This drill enhances lateral coordination, agility, and hip abductor/adductor strength.

exercises.name: A2) Lateral Recollects
exercises.exercise_summary: A lateral movement drill where the athlete takes a lateral step and then quickly 'recollects' or brings the trail foot towards the lead foot before stepping again. Focuses on quick footwork and efficiency in lateral shuffles. Performed to both right and left.

exercises.name: B1) Lateral Double Tap Rebounding hops
exercises.notes: Quickness off the ground
exercises.exercise_summary: Lateral hops with a quick double tap of the feet on the ground between each hop. Emphasizes rapid ground contact and reactive strength while moving sideways. Focus on quickness.

exercises.name: B2) 90 Degree Jump + Stick
exercises.notes: -Focus on extending and rotating as far as you can
exercises.exercise_summary: Perform a jump, rotate 90 degrees in the air (to left or right), and stick the landing securely. Focus on explosive rotation generated from the hips and core, and maintaining balance upon landing.

exercises.name: C1) 5-10-5 COD Drill
exercises.notes:
-Full 60 seonds rest between
-Race if you have a partner
exercises.exercise_summary: Also known as the pro-agility shuttle. Start at a center cone, sprint 5 yards to one side, touch the line/cone, sprint 10 yards to the opposite side, touch, and sprint 5 yards back to the start. Tests and develops rapid change of direction ability.

exercises.name: D1) Snake Sprints
exercises.notes:
-2 Minutes rest between each
-Great for angles + edges
exercises.exercise_summary: Sprinting in a serpentine or 'S' pattern around a series of cones over a 20-yard distance. This drill enhances agility, body control, and the ability to maintain speed while navigating turns and angles.

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) HURDLE HOP Progression #4
exercises.notes: Watch video and do progression #4 only. If no hurdles, use cones or immaginary hurdles
exercises.exercise_summary: Progression 4 of hurdle hops, representing a more advanced pattern or increased challenge in terms of speed, height, or coordination over the hurdles.

exercises.name: A2) Power Skip
exercises.exercise_summary: Power skips focusing on maximizing height and distance with each skip. Distance increased to 20 yards, demanding sustained explosive output.

exercises.name: B1) Continuous Broad Jumps
exercises.notes: Stick the last jump
exercises.exercise_summary: Multiple broad jumps performed consecutively, sticking only the last jump. Reps (jumps per set) increased to 5, building reactive strength and power endurance.

exercises.name: B2) Depth Jump For Height
exercises.exercise_summary: Jumping off a low box and immediately exploding into a vertical jump for maximum height. Reps increased to 5, further developing reactive vertical power.

exercises.name: C1) Wall Drill-Quick Switches
exercises.exercise_summary: Against a wall, quickly switch leg positions as if running in place. Reps (switches per set) increased to 10, enhancing rapid hip flexion/extension.

exercises.name: D1) Switching Gear Sprints
exercises.notes: -Full 60 seonds rest between each sprint
exercises.exercise_summary: Sprints over 20 yards involving changes in speed/gear. (Same as W3D1D1).

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) B-SKIP WALKS (WATCH FULL VIDEO)
exercises.notes: -ONLY Do the B-Skip WALK to get the pattern down
exercises.exercise_summary: The B-Skip performed as a walking drill to learn the specific leg action: extending the lead leg, then actively 'pawing' it back under the hip. Focus is on mastering the pattern before attempting at speed.

exercises.name: A2) Bounds
exercises.exercise_summary: Exaggerated running strides focusing on maximizing air time and horizontal distance. Distance increased to 15 yards.

blocks.block_name: B: Top End Speed Focused Plyos/Drills

exercises.name: B1) Rebounding Split Squat Jumps
exercises.notes: -Think to be twitchy!
exercises.exercise_summary: Split squat jumps performed continuously (rebounding) from one jump to the next without a pause. Emphasizes 'twitchy,' quick ground contact and reactive strength in a unilateral stance.

exercises.name: B2) Medball Alternating Drop Backs
exercises.exercise_summary: Holding a medicine ball, perform alternating drop-back lunges/steps over 15 yards. Challenges core stability and coordination under load over an increased distance.

exercises.name: C1) Backward Sprint
exercises.notes: -2 Minute rest between each
exercises.exercise_summary: Sprinting backward for 20 yards. (Same as W3D2C1).

exercises.name: D1) Sprint Build ups
exercises.notes:
Gradually pick up speed/intensity every 10 yards
-FULL 4 min rest after each sprint
exercises.exercise_summary: Sprints with progressively increasing speed. Reps increased to 4 total, maintaining long rest for quality.

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) Lateral Skips
exercises.exercise_summary: Skips performed laterally. Distance increased to 15 yards, demanding more sustained lateral agility.

exercises.name: A2) Lateral Recollects
exercises.exercise_summary: Lateral movement drill with quick foot recollection. Distance increased to 15 yards to the right/left.

exercises.name: B1) Lateral Double Tap Rebounding hops
exercises.notes: Quickness off the ground
exercises.exercise_summary: Lateral hops with a quick double tap of the feet, focusing on quickness off the ground. Reps increased to 5 each side.

exercises.name: B2) Rotational Jump Sequence
exercises.exercise_summary: A sequence of jumps involving various rotations (e.g., 90, 180, or combinations). This drill enhances body control, spatial awareness, and the ability to generate and absorb rotational forces. Performed 5 times in each rotational direction.

exercises.name: C1) Quick Burst Reactive Change of Direction Drill
exercises.sets_reps:
x4 total
Turn Left x2
Turn Right x2
exercises.notes:
:60 Rest Between each rep
-Great for hip health/crossover speed
exercises.exercise_summary: A drill involving a quick initial burst of speed followed by a reactive change of direction (e.g., left or right turn). Focuses on rapid decision-making, efficient cutting mechanics, hip mobility for crossover speed, and acceleration out of the turn.

exercises.name: D1) Snake Sprints
exercises.notes:
-2 Minutes rest between each
-Great for angles + edges
exercises.exercise_summary: Sprinting in a serpentine pattern around cones. Reps increased to 6, further developing agility and control on angles.

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) Seated Acceleration Drill
exercises.notes: Project out and burst for yards
exercises.exercise_summary: Starting from a seated position (e.g., on the ground or a low bench), the athlete explodes forward into a 10-yard sprint. This drill emphasizes powerful hip extension and overcoming inertia for initial acceleration.

exercises.name: A2) Band resisted angle step + sprint
exercises.notes: -3 steps each side first. Then 2 sprints each side x10 yds
exercises.exercise_summary: Perform 3 angled steps against band resistance (each side), then immediately detach or drop the band and perform 2 unresisted 10-yard sprints (each side). Develops power against resistance and then speed via post-activation potentiation.

exercises.name: B1) Double hop jump + Reach
exercises.exercise_summary: Perform two small, quick preliminary hops (double hop) and then immediately explode into a maximal jump, reaching for height or distance. The double hop serves as a potentiator for the main jump.

exercises.name: B2) Vertical to Broad Jump
exercises.exercise_summary: A combination plyometric where the athlete performs a maximal vertical jump, and upon landing, immediately transitions into a maximal broad jump. This drill enhances reactive strength and the ability to transfer vertical force into horizontal force.

exercises.name: C1) Drop Back Burst Sprints
exercises.sets_reps:
4 x 10 yards
2 Left back
2 Right back
exercises.notes: False Step work
exercises.exercise_summary: From a standing start, the athlete performs a quick 'false step' or drop step backward with one leg, then immediately and explosively bursts forward into a 10-yard sprint. This drill works on overcoming a slight backward momentum to accelerate powerfully. Performed with both left and right leg drop backs.

exercises.name: D1) Hill Sprints (reinforces acceleration angles)
exercises.notes:
-Find a moderate incline
-Full out sprint through. 90 rest between
-If no hill, do 15 yard sprints on field/court
exercises.exercise_summary: Sprinting uphill for 10 yards on a moderate incline. Hill sprints naturally reinforce proper forward lean and powerful leg drive, key components of acceleration. If no hill is available, perform 15-yard sprints on a flat surface as an alternative.

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) B-Skip
exercises.notes: -Practice the second part of the video
exercises.exercise_summary: The full B-Skip drill, progressing from the walking version. Involves extending the lead leg, actively 'pawing' it back under the hip while moving forward with a skipping rhythm. Focus on the dynamic execution shown in the latter part of the demo video.

exercises.name: A2) Single Leg Running
exercises.exercise_summary: Performing a running or continuous hopping motion on a single leg for 10 yards. This drill develops unilateral strength, power, balance, and coordination, crucial for efficient running. Done on each foot.

blocks.block_name: B: Top End Speed Focused Plyos/Drills

exercises.name: B1) Rebounding Split Squat Jumps
exercises.notes: Think to be twitchy and quick off the ground
exercises.exercise_summary: Continuous split squat jumps, emphasizing a 'twitchy' and quick rebound off the ground with minimal contact time. (Same as W4D2B1).

exercises.name: B2) Straight leg run
exercises.notes: -Learn to be bouncy first, then focus on speed + distance
exercises.exercise_summary: Running with relatively straight legs, focusing on a pawing/pulling motion of the foot under the hip and hamstring engagement. Initially, prioritize a bouncy, rhythmic feel, then progressively add speed and cover more distance.

exercises.name: C1) Power Gallops
exercises.notes: -:90 second rest between each
exercises.exercise_summary: Exaggerated gallops performed over 20 yards, focusing on powerful push-off from the lead leg and maximizing flight time and distance covered with each gallop. Helps develop explosive leg drive and hip projection. (Likely means 3-4 reps of 20 yards, based on typical set structure and rest).

exercises.name: D1) 40 Yard Sprint-ALL OUT SPRINT
exercises.notes:
-4 Minutes rest between each
-Time if possible (laser or handtime)
exercises.exercise_summary: Maximum effort sprints over 40 yards. This distance allows athletes to reach and maintain top speed for a longer duration. Full rest for quality. Timing encouraged.

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) Lateral alternating A Skip
exercises.exercise_summary: Performing A-Skips while moving laterally (sideways), alternating the lead leg for the high knee drive. This drill enhances lateral agility, coordination, and hip flexor/abductor strength.

exercises.name: A2) Open Up Change of Direction Drill
exercises.notes: Sprint up, then quickly open up and sprint back
exercises.exercise_summary: The athlete sprints forward a short distance, then performs a quick hip turn ('opening up') to change direction (e.g., 90 or 180 degrees) and sprints out of the turn. Focuses on efficient hip rotation and re-acceleration.

exercises.name: B1) Continuous Lateral Bounds To Vertical Jumps
exercises.notes: Jump as far as you can over and then up
exercises.exercise_summary: A combination plyometric drill where the athlete performs a lateral bound off one leg, and upon landing on the opposite leg, immediately explodes into a maximal vertical jump. This is repeated continuously for the prescribed reps, focusing on transferring lateral force to vertical force and reactive ability.

exercises.name: B2) Rotational Overhead MB Slams
exercises.exercise_summary: Holding a medicine ball, the athlete rotates their torso and powerfully slams the ball down towards the ground, typically to the side or slightly in front. This exercise develops rotational power, core strength, and explosive force transfer through the kinetic chain.

exercises.name: C1) Cirlce Change of Direction
exercises.notes:
-About 8-10 yard big circle
-Full 60 seonds rest between
exercises.exercise_summary: The athlete runs in a circle (approximately 8-10 yards in diameter), and on a cue or pre-determined point, quickly changes direction to run the circle the opposite way or cuts across. This drill enhances agility, body control while turning, and the ability to react and change direction smoothly.

exercises.name: D1) Goal line Tag Game
exercises.notes:
1-2 min rest after each round
3 reps on offense and defense
exercises.exercise_summary: A tag game played in a confined area, often near a designated 'goal line'. Involves short bursts of speed, agility, quick changes of direction to evade a tagger (defense) or tag someone (offense). Promotes reactive agility in a competitive context. Total of 6 rounds, alternating offense/defense.

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) Seated Acceleration Drill
exercises.notes: Project out and burst for yards
exercises.exercise_summary: Starting seated, explode forward into a sprint. Distance increased to 15 yards, demanding more sustained acceleration from a static start.

exercises.name: A2) Band resisted angle step + sprint
exercises.notes: -3 steps each side first. Then 2 sprints each side x10 yds
exercises.exercise_summary: Angled steps against band resistance, followed by unresisted sprints. (Same as W5D1A2).

exercises.name: B1) Double hop jump + Reach
exercises.exercise_summary: Perform two small preliminary hops then explode into a maximal jump. Sets increased to 4, maintaining 5 reps per set for increased volume.

exercises.name: B2) Depth Jump to 2 Broad Jumps
exercises.notes: Use a box, chair, bench
exercises.exercise_summary: Dropping off a low elevation (box, chair, bench) and upon landing, immediately perform two consecutive maximal broad jumps. This advanced plyometric enhances reactive strength and the ability to produce repeated horizontal power.

exercises.name: C1) Drop Back Burst Sprints
exercises.sets_reps:
4 x 10 yards
2 Left back
2 Right back
exercises.notes: False Step work
exercises.exercise_summary: Perform a quick false step backward, then burst forward into a 10-yard sprint. (Same as W5D1C1).

exercises.name: D1) Hill Sprints (reinforces acceleration angles)
exercises.notes:
-Find a moderate incline
-Full out sprint through. 90 rest between
-If no hill, do 15 yard sprints on field/court
exercises.exercise_summary: Sprint uphill for 10 yards. Reps increased to 6, further developing acceleration-specific strength and power. Flat ground sprints as alternative.

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) B-Skip
exercises.notes: -Practice the second part of the video
exercises.exercise_summary: Full B-Skip drill. Distance increased to 20 yards, demanding proficiency and endurance in executing the pawing leg action.

exercises.name: A2) Single Leg Running
exercises.exercise_summary: Running or hopping on a single leg for 10 yards each foot. (Same as W5D2A2).

blocks.block_name: B: Top End Speed Focused Plyos/Drills

exercises.name: B1) Double Tap + Quick Switch Jump
exercises.notes: -Think to be twitchy!
exercises.exercise_summary: A combination drill involving a double tap pogo action (quick double foot contact on the ground) followed immediately by a quick switch jump (rapidly exchanging foot positions, potentially with a small jump). Emphasizes 'twitchy,' reactive movements and rapid force production.

exercises.name: B2) Straight leg run
exercises.exercise_summary: Running with relatively straight legs, focusing on a pawing motion and hamstring engagement. (Same as W5D2B2).

exercises.name: C1) Power Gallops
exercises.notes: -:90 second rest between each
exercises.exercise_summary: Exaggerated gallops over 20 yards, focusing on powerful push-off. Reps increased to 3 sets of 20 yards.

exercises.name: D1) 40 Yard Sprint-ALL OUT SPRINT
exercises.notes:
-4 Minutes rest between each
-Time if possible (laser or handtime)
exercises.exercise_summary: Maximum effort sprints over 40 yards. Total reps increased to 3, maintaining long rest for high-quality efforts.

exercises.name: DAILY WARM UP VIDEO TO BE DONE PRIOR TO EACH DAY
exercises.exercise_summary: A comprehensive dynamic warm-up routine designed to prepare the body for speed and agility workouts, including movements to increase blood flow, activate muscles, and improve range of motion.

exercises.name: A1) Lateral alternating A Skip
exercises.exercise_summary: Lateral A-Skips, alternating lead leg for high knee drive while moving sideways. (Same as W5D3A1).

exercises.name: A2) Tracking Drill With Crossover
exercises.exercise_summary: An agility drill where the athlete focuses on 'tracking' a moving object or partner, primarily using crossover steps to adjust position and change direction. Enhances defensive footwork, spatial awareness, and lateral mobility.

exercises.name: B1) Continuous Lateral Bounds To Vertical Jumps
exercises.notes: Jump as far as you can over and then up
exercises.exercise_summary: Perform a lateral bound to one side, then immediately transition into a vertical jump. Repeat continuously. Reps increased to 5 each side, enhancing lateral-to-vertical power transfer.

exercises.name: B2) Rotational Overhead MB Slams
exercises.exercise_summary: Medicine ball slams with torso rotation. Reps increased to 5 each side, further developing rotational power and core strength.

exercises.name: C1) Cirlce Change of Direction
exercises.notes:
-About 8-10 yard big circle
-Full 60 seonds rest between
exercises.exercise_summary: Run in a circle, then quickly change direction. Reps increased to 4 each way, challenging agility and body control during turns.

exercises.name: D1) Tap Tag
exercises.notes:
-2 Minutes rest between each
-Alternate offense vs defense
-If SOLO (DO THIS INSTEAD)
exercises.exercise_summary: A reactive tag game played in a confined space, alternating offense and defense roles. Focuses on agility, quick bursts, and evasive movements. If playing solo, an alternative agility drill should be performed (specific solo drill not explicitly provided in the plan text).

conclusion: I want to extend a huge THANK YOU for following along with this program. I hope through following this program over the last 6 weeks you improved your speed, movement ability, knowledge while having fun and working hard. Please let me know if there is anything else I can assist you with in the realm of sport performance and be sure to follow me along at all my social media handles simple at JoeAratari.
